function.description: Converts rectangular coordinates to spherical coordinates in the format (rho, theta, phi).
function.name: convert_rectangular_to_spherical

function.description: Calculates the product of two matrices using sympy and returns the resulting matrix.
function.name: compute_matrix_multiplication

function.description: Calculate the sum of the squares of the cosine of angles from 0 to a specified number of degrees using the sympy package.
function.name: sum_of_cos_squared

degrees.description: The upper bound of the range in degrees to calculate the sum of cos^2 from 0 to this degree.

function.description: Solve for the angles of a triangle given its side lengths using the Law of Cosines.
function.name: solve_triangle_angles

function.description: Compute the projection of vector v onto vector w using the dot product.
function.name: compute_vector_projection

function.description: Evaluate arithmetic or mathematical expressions provided as strings and return the result as a simplified expression.
function.name: evaluate_math_expression

expression.description: The mathematical expression or equation to evaluate.

function.description: Convert a point from rectangular coordinates to spherical coordinates (rho, theta, phi) where rho > 0, 0 <= theta < 2*pi, and 0 <= phi <= pi.
function.name: convert_coordinates_to_spherical

function.description: Finds the equation of a plane given three points in 3D space. The result is simplified to integers where applicable, ensuring greatest common divisor of coefficients is 1.
function.name: find_plane_equation_from_points

function.description: Calculate the tangent of the difference of two angles using the tangent subtraction formula.
function.name: solve_tangent_difference

function.description: Solves a variety of mathematical problems by formulating equations, systems of equations, and numeric computations using SymPy. Includes enhancements for better parsing, evaluation, and handling of specific symbolic expressions and numeric calculations. Now with improved parsing for exceptions and refined input recognition for equations and geometric problems.
function.name: solve_question_with_sympy

problem_description.description: The problem to solve, described in natural language.

variables.description: Variables involved in the problem statement, used for symbolic evaluation.

function.description: Calculate the tangent of the difference between two angles given their tangents.
function.name: evaluate_tangent_difference
